Posts.Content: twipsy wrote: Hi all,  I am now NED since 2004, when I had a lumpectomy, chemo and radiation on my right breast for stage IIA invasive ductal bc.  I also had a radial axillary node resection after cancer was found in one node.  Afterward, I had a breast lymphedema, which never travelled to my arm.  I've been very careful all these years to prevent it, but my breast has remained a little enlarged.   However, I now require mitral valve repair surgery.  It might be performed robotically.  Although it is a minimally invasive procedure, there will be incisions in my right breast, right near the site of the lymph node removal.  I am very afraid of developing lymphedema after this surgery.  Although I told the surgeon my issues, he said that an IV still has to be run on both arms.   How great is my risk after 8 years?  Does anyone have any suggestions for me?  The leak in my heart is severe and there is no way I can avoid the surgery.  Dx 5/1/2004, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/16 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: lymphedema risk with heart surgery twipsy lymphedemapeople
